casebody.data:
Josephine Stampfer, Resp’t, v. Siegmund alias William Stampfer, App’lt. (New York Superior Court,

General Term,

Filed November 3, 1890.) Divorce—Extra allowance. Courts have no power to make allowance to a wife for past expenses incurred in an action for divorce. Appeal from an order granting plaintiff an allowance for counsel fee. Louis Ausbaden, for app’lt; Samuel D. Sewards, for resp’t. Peb Curiam.

This case cannot be distinguished in any material respect from the case of Beadleston v. Beadleston, 103 N. Y., 402; 3 N. Y. State Rep., 634.

The order appealed from is reversed and the motion denied, without costs.

Fbeedman, Tbuax and Ingraham, JJ., concur.
